segment.source: 6281(F) Code Integrity determined that the page hashes of an image file are not valid.
segment.target: 6281(F) Code Integrity determined that the page hashes of an image file are not valid.

segment.source: (Windows 10)
segment.target: (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes security event 6281(F) Code Integrity determined that the page hashes of an image file are not valid.
segment.target: Describes security event 6281(F) Code Integrity determined that the page hashes of an image file are not valid.

segment.source: 6281(F): Code Integrity determined that the page hashes of an image file are not valid.
segment.target: 6281(F): Code Integrity determined that the page hashes of an image file are not valid.

segment.source: The file could be improperly signed without page hashes or corrupt due to unauthorized modification.
segment.target: The file could be improperly signed without page hashes or corrupt due to unauthorized modification.

segment.source: The invalid hashes could indicate a potential disk device error.
segment.target: The invalid hashes could indicate a potential disk device error.

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016
segment.target: Windows Server 2016

segment.source: The file could be improperly signed without page hashes or corrupt due to unauthorized modification.
segment.target: The file could be improperly signed without page hashes or corrupt due to unauthorized modification.

segment.source: The invalid hashes could indicate a potential disk device error.
segment.target: The invalid hashes could indicate a potential disk device error.

segment.source: Code Integrity is a feature that improves the security of the operating system by validating the integrity of a driver or system file each time it is loaded into memory.
segment.target: Code Integrity is a feature that improves the security of the operating system by validating the integrity of a driver or system file each time it is loaded into memory.

segment.source: Code Integrity detects whether an unsigned driver or system file is being loaded into the kernel, or whether a system file has been modified by malicious software that is being run by a user account with administrative permissions.
segment.target: Code Integrity detects whether an unsigned driver or system file is being loaded into the kernel, or whether a system file has been modified by malicious software that is being run by a user account with administrative permissions.

segment.source: On x64-based versions of the operating system, kernel-mode drivers must be digitally signed.
segment.target: On x64-based versions of the operating system, kernel-mode drivers must be digitally signed.

segment.source: This event generates when code Integrity determined that the page hashes of an image file are not valid.
segment.target: This event generates when code Integrity determined that the page hashes of an image file are not valid.

segment.source: The file could be improperly signed without page hashes or corrupt due to unauthorized modification.
segment.target: The file could be improperly signed without page hashes or corrupt due to unauthorized modification.

segment.source: This event also generates when signing certificate was revoked.
segment.target: This event also generates when signing certificate was revoked.

segment.source: The invalid hashes could indicate a potential disk device error.
segment.target: The invalid hashes could indicate a potential disk device error.

segment.source: There is no example of this event in this document.
segment.target: There is no example of this event in this document.

segment.source: Security Monitoring Recommendations
segment.target: Security Monitoring Recommendations

segment.source: We recommend monitoring for this event, especially on high value assets or computers, because it can be a sign of a software or configuration issue, or a malicious action.
segment.target: We recommend monitoring for this event, especially on high value assets or computers, because it can be a sign of a software or configuration issue, or a malicious action.
